events.name: Cloud Native Roadshow
events.description:
Hey Everyone,  We would like to welcome you to join us for an exciting daytime event @ Google's Office. Over the course of the day, you'll learn about the Pivotal Cloud Foundry platform and building applications with Spring Boot, while leveraging Google Cloud Platform for reliability and at-scale data management service integrations. We have an amazing line up of speakers and Cloud Foundry experts from Google and Pivotal, USA. • Casey West, Google - Casey works in internet infrastructure, web app security, and design. All of which have influenced Casey to be a paranoid, UX-oriented, problem-solving internet plumber; his earliest contributions to Perl, live to this day on your Mac. Casey’s speaking and writing ranges from open source communities and culture to technical architecture and automation tips and tricks.  • Cameron Stewart, Pivotal - She has a full-stack developer background thanks to the Galvanize Full Stack Developer program which makes her fiercely passionate about all things cloud-native, 12 factor and agile. • Jeff Johnson, Google - Jeff is a Software Engineer at Google who is giving developers super powers by integrating the tools that run Google with open source Cloud Foundry. He has worked closely with the excellent engineers at Pivotal on the stackdriver-tools BOSH release to integrate Google's Logging, Monitoring, Tracing, and Debugging with Cloud Foundry. Today he is working with Pivotal on bringing Kubernetes' container orchestration strengths to complement Cloud Foundry applications.  For the full agenda, please check out our registration page. Make sure you don't miss out on this one off event by registering via the dedicated registration page at this link: https://pivotal.io/event/pivotal-cloud-native-roadshow/singapore 


Articles By Casey West The Cloud Native Future - O'Reilly Achieving Cloud Native Operability with Microservices, DevOps and Continuous Delivery - O'Reilly
events.location: Google, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71  Mapletree Business City  Singapore 117372

events.name: Docker and Ashnik Tech Insights

events.name: Inaugural KDD.SG Tutorial: Hands-On Machine Learning in R - Getting Started
events.description: Update #2: The registration is now closed.  If you have registered over the Google Form, and received a confirmation over SMS, we will be expecting you on Thursday 14 Sep'17.  Please set up for the tutorial beforehand: https://togaware.com/setting-up-r-for-a-tutorial/. ---- Update #1: The venue has been changed.  It's still in MAS Building, but it will now be the more capacious MAS Theatrette.  Please remember to register over the Google Form, and not over Meetup. ---- SIGKDD Singapore and Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) are jointly organizing this tutorial. Please RSVP on this link instead of over Meetup (more details below). Title: Hands-On Machine Learning in R - Getting Started Speaker: Graham Williams is the Director of Data Science, Microsoft Asia, Singapore.  Graham joined Microsoft recently after over 30 years as researcher, developer and educator in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Mining, Analytics and Data Science. He was previously lead Data Scientist for the Australian Government's Center of Excellence in Data Analytics, Director of Data Science at the Australian Taxation Office, and Principal Research Scientist with CSIRO Australia. Over those 30 years he has also been an active contributor to the Open Source ecosystem with open source software projects across Emacs, Linux, Data Science, and R. Graham has authored many books, papers, Internet resources and software packages for data scientists. His latest book released in July 2017 introduces the Essentials of Data Science through a programming-by-example based approach to knowledge discovery in R. He maintains an extensive collection of R and Data Science resources on https://togaware.com. Abstract: Machine learning underlies much of today's technological advances driving enterprises who are embracing data and information to become knowledge-driven organisations. R is a popular ecosystem for Knowledge Discovery, Machine Learning and Data Science. It has grown over the past 20 years from a specialist tool for a handful of statisticians to an estimated 4 million users today. It provides a platform for building and deploying machine learning based models.  This tutorial will introduce, with a hands-on focus, the R ecosystem for Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. We will understand some of the most widely used machine learning algorithms, including decision trees, and explore how we build models R. The concepts of ensembles will also be introduced as the state-of-the-art classification learner. The tutorial will focus on hands-on learning so that all attendees will gain the experience to then continue with building such models on their own. A particular focus is on the use of readily repeatable template scripts for our tasks. Date/Time Thursday September 14, 2017, beginning with light reception at 6pm Venue MAS Theatrette, Level 16, MAS Building, 10 Shenton Way, Singapore[masked] Preparation Bring your own laptop with your own internet connectivity (or Wireless@SG available on-site) for use of the X2Go application which you should also install. If you have no network connectivity then be sure to install R and Rattle and related packages prior to the session. RSVP on this link, and provide the required info for entry into the venue.  We do not accept RSVP over Meetup.  Due to limited capacity, we will send you a confirmation email if your registration is accepted.  Attendance will be recorded. Call for Tutorials We are also inviting submissions from the community members who are interested in contributing a future tutorial.  View our Call for Tutorials. This tutorial is brought to you by: https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/ccjTKNQylqQ_4i6nAsFtylSQ97_0hU8lpHT9PpcDvK92a4FFBbiWLU0UWF5S6VV9NuLObqKio3kZ4xDmKLDT9H4BwBs8aANWcS-_n7sih54x_RIaip50q_RUAtDahRMUf2mS8rWY https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/UVYY5o8etcxu-QRnuGGGbIBou4GFJTc2Zwi7O7roy-SetyeuEQTlJexsUjldyk9fSZASl7FhJecztmDsPI267b4Ul993x0TOQTbxJk6WeKA0u5qIApX3Vqa4riDFIxbSmG84B6k4
events.location: MAS Building, Level 16, MAS Theatrette, 10 Shenton Way, Singapore 079117

events.name: Future Proof: AI, Humanity, and the 4th Revolution
events.description:
The human race can no longer deny that we are entering the 4th industrial revolution where AI, robotics, and tech-driven ventures drive the workforce, and our lives. The questions that are paramount for us to ask – as individuals, as society, and collectively as the human race - Will technology take over the world? How much control are we relinquishing or are we still in control? How do we stay relevant and authentic?
Together, we explore the possibilities of the human mind - our powers of adaptability, creativity, intuition, and the ability to inspire. Do machines exhibit such qualities, are we creating them to possess such qualities?
Come join us as we dig deep into the self-consciousness of what it is to be human today, and how we can become better versions of ourselves in this new world order.


Panelists
Yen-Lu Chow, Founder of Over the Rainbow  Anuj Jain, Co-founder and CEO of Startup-OAnh-Minh Do, Director of Communications of Vertex Ventures

Moderated by


FAQs

What should I bring to the event?
An open mind, and the willingness to engage and explore.
Is there going to be food?
Torched (Poke Bowl) will be open for dinner. Bowls are from $10 and up.
What are my transport/parking options?
By Car: You can park at either Laselle College of the Arts or Singapore Pools Building.
By Public Transportation: The nearest MRT Stations are Rochor (2 mins walk) and Bugis (5 mins walk).
Where can I find out more?
Check us out on our Facebook Event page for constant updates.
I have more questions that you didn't talk about here.
You can reach us at hello@tabularasa.com.sg or simply drop us a message on our Facebook page.

events.name: Agile Teams - Stand-up Anti Patterns
events.description: Stand-ups are one of the popular ceremonies in present-day projects (software or otherwise). Much has been written about Stand-ups. How should we determine whether our Stand-ups are effective or not? As with many things, there are pros and cons of various approaches. In this talk, Ram (http://www.sriramnarayanan.com/) will share the lessons learned on how to run efficient Stand-ups, the anti-patterns to watch out for, and how to change direction and culture for achieving the goals of a team. About the speaker: Sriram "Ram" Narayanan (http://www.sriramnarayanan.com/) is a Principal Consultant with 23 years of experience in the IT field. He has spend the past 12 years at ThoughtWorks with the good fortune to have played the various roles of developer, architect, Infrastructure Engineer, and Build and Release engineer. He has worked with clients across the world in the domains of banking, insurance, e-commerce, government services and retail. Along the way, he has made mistakes and learned from them. Today, he advises customers on how to deliver software reliably, on time and by managing budgets well. Ram has presented in the past at the DevSecCon, the DevOpsDays, and the Global Scrum alliance. He is working on a book on Security and Continuous Delivery based on everyday lessons. Agenda: 6.30 to 7.00 pm - Snacks & networking 7.00 to 8.00 pm - Session by Ram 8.00 pm Onwards - Snacks & networking
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Enabling IoT Solutions with LoRa- Actility & ThingPark
events.description: Existing networks, whether cellular, broadband or wifi, have been developed to connect people to one another, or computers to the internet. They are designed for communication or entertainment: high volumes of data delivered with low latency. IoT devices don’t need to transmit or receive large amounts of data at a time; IoT devices can be anywhere, not just in someone’s living room or office; and many IoT devices will be remote and inaccessible, or without power connections. A new connectivity solution, called Low Power Wide Area Networking, has been developed, pioneered by Actility amongst others, to address specifically the requirements of the internet of things. The most widely adopted LPWA solutions are the open standards of LoRAWAN™ and 3GPP (LTE Cat M1 and Cat NB1). In this session we will listen from Actility's expert team on how they have enabled solutions such as Smart Factories,  Connected FuelTank, Smart Buildings, SupplyChain and many more. SPEAKERS:  ************************************************************  DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 14th Sept  2017 • 06:30 pm- Registration/ Networking • 06:50 pm- Introduction by CK • 07:00 pm-Intro about Actility and ThingPark by Arnaud • 07:35 pm- LoRaWAN use cases by Peter • 08:10 pm- ThingPark partner portal demo by Arnaud & QnA • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01, SG139951 ************************************************************   About Actility & ThingPark™ Actility is the industry leader in LPWA (Low Power Wide Area) large-scale infrastructure and the innovator behind the ThingPark IoT Solution platform. Actility’s ThingPark enables scalable LPWA networks and interoperable IoT applications and services. ThingPark Wireless is a core network management and supervision solution for LPWA connectivity designed from the beginning for carrier-grade solutions, and already deployed in over half the national LPWA network rollouts globally. ThingPark OS is a central IoT management service to connect sensors to applications with bidirectional interaction. ThingPark X is a data analytics and control framework which exposes data from connected things to applications and connects with cloud platforms, and also offers off the shelf IoT industrial applications. ThingPark Market is a B2B ecommerce platform for buyers and sellers, aggregating, distributing and connecting IoT devices and applications to the ThingPark platform. Actility is a founding member of the LoRa Alliance. http://www.actility.com **************************************************************** Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
